alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 3:11PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Marion, southwestern Cass, northwestern Harrison and northeastern Upshur Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 311 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gilmer, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gilmer, Jefferson, Ore City, Diana, Lodi, Woodlawn, Berea, Harleton, Cedar Springs, Kildare, Avinger, Midway, Lassater, Pruett and Bettie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for northeastern Texas.
